CohortSurvival 0.5.1

    Plot survival results

    plotSurvival.Rd

    Plot survival results

    Usage

    plotSurvival(
  result,
  x = "time",
  xscale = "days",
  ylim = c(0, NA),
  cumulativeFailure = FALSE,
  ribbon = TRUE,
  facet = NULL,
  colour = NULL,
  colourName = NULL
)

    Arguments

    result

    Survival results

    x

    Variable to plot on x axis

    xscale

    X axis scale. Can be "days" or "years".

    ylim

    Limits for the Y axis

    cumulativeFailure

    whether to plot the cumulative failure probability instead of the survival probability

    ribbon

    If TRUE, the plot will join points using a ribbon

    facet

    Variables to use for facets

    colour

    Variables to use for colours

    colourName

    Colour legend name

    Value

    A plot of survival probabilities over time

    Examples

    # \donttest{
cdm <- mockMGUS2cdm()
#> Warning: ! 4 column in person do not match expected column type:
#> • `person_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `gender_concept_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `year_of_birth` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `month_of_birth` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 1 column in observation_period do not match expected column type:
#> • `person_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 5 column in visit_occurrence do not match expected column type:
#> • `visit_occurrence_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `person_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `visit_concept_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `visit_start_date` is character but expected date
#> • `visit_end_date` is character but expected date
#> Warning: ! 1 casted column in death_cohort (cohort_set) as do not match expected column
#>   type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` from numeric to integer
#> Warning: ! 6 casted column in death_cohort (cohort_attrition) as do not match expected
#>   column type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` from numeric to integer
#> • `number_records` from numeric to integer
#> • `number_subjects` from numeric to integer
#> • `reason_id` from numeric to integer
#> • `excluded_records` from numeric to integer
#> • `excluded_subjects` from numeric to integer
#> Warning: ! 1 column in death_cohort do not match expected column type:
#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 1 casted column in mgus_diagnosis (cohort_set) as do not match expected
#>   column type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` from numeric to integer
#> Warning: ! 6 casted column in mgus_diagnosis (cohort_attrition) as do not match expected
#>   column type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` from numeric to integer
#> • `number_records` from numeric to integer
#> • `number_subjects` from numeric to integer
#> • `reason_id` from numeric to integer

#> • `excluded_subjects` from numeric to integer

#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 1 casted column in progression (cohort_set) as do not match expected column
#>   type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` from numeric to integer
#> Warning: ! 6 casted column in progression (cohort_attrition) as do not match expected
#>   column type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` from numeric to integer
#> • `number_records` from numeric to integer
#> • `number_subjects` from numeric to integer
#> • `reason_id` from numeric to integer
#> • `excluded_records` from numeric to integer
#> • `excluded_subjects` from numeric to integer

#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer

#>   expected column type:

#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 4 column in person do not match expected column type:
#> • `person_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `gender_concept_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `year_of_birth` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `month_of_birth` is numeric but expected integer

#> • `person_id` is numeric but expected integer

#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 1 column in progression do not match expected column type:
#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> Warning: ! 2 column in progression_type do not match expected column type:
#> • `cohort_definition_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
surv <- estimateSingleEventSurvival(cdm,
                                    targetCohortTable = "mgus_diagnosis",
                                    outcomeCohortTable = "death_cohort")
#> Warning: ! 1 column in death_cohort do not match expected column type:
#> • `subject_id` is numeric but expected integer
#> - Getting survival for target cohort 'mgus_diagnosis' and outcome cohort
#> 'death_cohort'
#> Getting overall estimates
plotSurvival(surv)
